info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 4:14PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Esperanza, moving north at 10 mph. Additional strong thunderstorms were popping up across southern Hudspeth County, mainly north and west of Sierra Blanca. Additional thunderstorm development is likely in the region over the next hour.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations which may be impacted include... Sierra Blanca, Indian Hot Springs, Fort Quitman, Esperanza, Finlay, McNary, Quitman Canyon, Sunset Ranches, Round Top Mountain, Big Box, and Little Box.
This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 75 and 116.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
